connectorUiConfig.title: Cyfirma Cyber Intelligence
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Cyfirma Cyber Intelligence data connector enables seamless log ingestion from the DeCYFIR API into Microsoft Sentinel. Built on the Microsoft Sentinel Codeless Connector Platform, it leverages the DeCYFIR Alerts API to retrieve logs. Additionally, it supports DCR-based [ingestion time transformations](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/custom-logs-overview), which parse security data into a custom table during ingestion. This eliminates the need for query-time parsing, enhancing performance and efficiency.

dataFlows.transformKql:
source 
| extend
    TimeGenerated=created,
    ThreatType=indicator_types[0],
    Tags=labels,
    ConfidenceScore = confidence,
    Description=description,
    IndicatorID = id
| extend ParsedJson = parse_json(extensions)
| extend ExtensionID = extract(@"(extension-definition--[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12})", 1, tostring(extensions))
| extend ext = ParsedJson[ExtensionID]
| extend props = ext.properties
| extend 
    ThreatActors = props.threat_actors,
    Country = props.country,
    RecommendedActions = tostring(props.recommended_actions),
    SecurityVendors=  tostring(props.security_vendors),
    Sources = tostring(props.sources),
    Roles = tostring(props.roles),
    IPAbuse= tostring(props.ip_abuse_categories)
| project-away
    ['type'],
    ParsedJson,
    ExtensionID,
    ext,
    props,
    confidence,
    labels,
    indicator_types,
    id,
    description,
    pattern_type,
    spec_version

source
| extend
    TimeGenerated=created,
    Aliases=aliases,
    ThreatType=threat_actor_types[0],
    PrimaryMotivation=primary_motivation,
    Description=description
| extend ParsedJson = parse_json(extensions)
| extend ExtensionID = extract(@"(extension-definition--[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12})", 1, tostring(extensions))
| extend ext = ParsedJson[ExtensionID]
| extend props = ext.properties
| extend 
    Country = props["origin-of-country"],
    TargetCountries = props["target-countries"],
    TargetIndustries = props["target-industries"],
    TargetTechnologies = props["target-technologies"]
| project-away type, ParsedJson, ExtensionID, ext, props, threat_actor_types, spec_version, primary_motivation,aliases,description

source
| extend
    TimeGenerated = last_seen,
    Name=name,
    CampaignID=id,
    Description=description,
    Aliases=aliases,
    Modified=modified,
    FirstSeen=first_seen,
    LastSeen=last_seen,
    Created=created
| extend ParsedJson = parse_json(extensions)
| extend ExtensionID = extract(@"(extension-definition--[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12})", 1, tostring(extensions))
| extend ext = ParsedJson[ExtensionID]
| extend props = ext.properties
| extend 
    Country = props["geographies"],
    Technologies = props["technologies"],
    Industries = props["industries"]
| project-away
    ParsedJson,
    created,
    name,
    id,
    description,
    aliases,
    ExtensionID,
    ext,
    props,
    spec_version,
    ['type'],
    first_seen,
    modified,
    last_seen

source
| extend
    TimeGenerated=last_seen,
    Name=name,
    MalwareID=id,
    Description=description,
    Aliases=aliases,
    Modified=modified,
    FirstSeen=first_seen,
    LastSeen=last_seen,
    Created=created,
    ThreatType=malware_types[0],
    IsFamily=is_family
| extend ParsedJson = parse_json(extensions)
| extend ExtensionID = extract(@"(extension-definition--[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12})", 1, tostring(extensions))
| extend ext = ParsedJson[ExtensionID]
| extend props = ext.properties
| extend 
    Countries = props["geographies"],
    Technologies = props["technologies"]
| project-away
    ParsedJson,
    created,
    name,
    id,
    description,
    aliases,
    ExtensionID,
    ext,
    props,
    spec_version,
    ['type'],
    first_seen,
    modified,
    last_seen,
    malware_types,
    is_family

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The Cyfirma Cyber Intelligence solution integrates with Microsoft Sentinel to provide actionable intelligence on IOCs, threat actors, malicious campaigns, and malware. This integration enables security teams to detect, analyze, and respond to emerging threats by correlating external threat data with internal telemetry. By ingesting enriched threat intelligence into Sentinel, organizations gain visibility into malicious activity, track threat actor tactics, and automate defense mechanisms to mitigate risks proactively.

Data Connectors: 1
